Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages CPU AHB I-Code and D-Code accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Peripheral.Name: Data EEPROM
Peripheral.Description: The Data EEPROM memory block. It contains user data.

Peripheral.Name: OTP
Peripheral.Description: The Data OTP memory block. It contains the one time programmable bits.

Bit.Name: PRODUCT_STATE
Bit.Description: Life state code.

Values.Val: Closed, Debug disabled, regression is possible

Bit.Name: PRODUCT_STATE
Bit.Description: Life state code.

Values.Val: Closed, Debug disabled, regression is possible

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: Brownout level option status bit.

Values.Val: BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)
BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)
BOR Level 2, the threshold level is medium (around 2.4 V)
BOR Level 3, the threshold level is high (around 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: Brownout level option status bit.

Values.Val: BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)
BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)
BOR Level 2, the threshold level is medium (around 2.4 V)
BOR Level 3, the threshold level is high (around 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: BORH_EN
Bit.Description: Brownout high enable configuration bit
Bit.Val: disabled
enabled

Bit.Name: BORH_EN
Bit.Description: Brownout high enable configuration bit
Bit.Val: disabled
enabled

Bit.Name: IO_VDD_HSLV
Bit.Description: VDD I/O high-speed at low-voltage status bit.
Bit.Val: Product working in the full voltage range, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage disabled
VDD I/O below 2.5 V, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage feature allowed

Bit.Name: IO_VDD_HSLV
Bit.Description: VDD I/O high-speed at low-voltage status bit.

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage configuration bit
Bit.Val: Product working in the full voltage range, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage disabled
VDD I/O below 2.5 V, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage feature allowed

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage configuration bit
Bit.Val: Product working in the full voltage range, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage disabled
VDD I/O below 2.5 V, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage feature allowed

Independent watchdog keep running in system Stop mode.

Bit.Name: IWDG_STDBY
Bit.Description: Standby mode freeze option status bit.
Bit.Val: Independent watchdog frozen in system standby mode
Independent watchdog keep running in standby Stop mode.

Bit.Name: BOOT_UBE
Bit.Description: Unique boot entry control, selects either ST or OEM iRoT for secure boot.

Bit.Name: BOOT_UBE
Bit.Description: Unique boot entry control, selects either ST or OEM iRoT for secure boot.

Bit.Name: SWAP_BANK

bank 1 and bank 2 swapped

Bit.Name: NRST_STOP
Bit.Description: Core domain Stop entry reset option status bit.
Bit.Val: a reset is generated when entering Stop or Stop2 mode on core domain
no reset generated when entering Stop or Stop2 mode on core domain

Bit.Name: TZEN
Bit.Description: Trust Zone Enable configuration bits

Bit.Name: SRAM2_ECC
Bit.Description: ECC in SRAM2 region configuration bit

Bit.Name: SRAM3_ECC
Bit.Description: ECC in SRAM3 region configuration bit

Bit.Name: BKPRAM_ECC
Bit.Description: ECC in BKPRAM region configuration bit

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 Erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: SRAM1_3_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM1 and SRAM3 erase upon system reset

Values.Val: SRAM1 and SRAM3 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 and SRAM3 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: TZEN
Bit.Description: Trust Zone Enable configuration bits

Bit.Name: SRAM2_ECC

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 Erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: SRAM1_3_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM1 and SRAM3 erase upon system reset

Values.Val: SRAM1 and SRAM3 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 and SRAM3 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Non secure unique boot entry address

Bit.Name: NSBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of SWAP_BANK, and NSBOOTADD settings

Values.Val: The SWAP_BANK and NSBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The NSBOOTADD is frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Non secure unique boot entry address

Bit.Name: NSBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of SWAP_BANK, and NSBOOTADD settings

Values.Val: The SWAP_BANK and NSBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The NSBOOTADD is frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: SECBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of UBE, SWAP_BANK, and SECBOOTADD settings.

Values.Val: The BOOT_UBE, SWAP_BANK and SECBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The BOOT_UBE and SECBOOTADD are frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: SECBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Unique Boot Entry Secure Adress

Bit.Name: SECBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of UBE, SWAP_BANK, and SECBOOTADD settings.

Values.Val: The BOOT_UBE, SWAP_BANK and SECBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The BOOT_UBE and SECBOOTADD are frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: SECBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Unique Boot Entry Secure Adress.

SRAM1 and SRAM3 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Non secure unique boot entry address

Bit.Name: NSBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of SWAP_BANK, and NSBOOTADD settings

Values.Val: The SWAP_BANK and NSBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The NSBOOTADD is frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Non secure unique boot entry address

Bit.Name: NSBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of SWAP_BANK, and NSBOOTADD settings

Values.Val: The SWAP_BANK and NSBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The NSBOOTADD is frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: SECBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of UBE, SWAP_BANK, and SECBOOTADD settings.

Values.Val: The BOOT_UBE, SWAP_BANK and SECBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The BOOT_UBE and SECBOOTADD are frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: SECBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Unique Boot Entry Secure Adress

Bit.Name: SECBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of UBE, SWAP_BANK, and SECBOOTADD settings.

Values.Val: The BOOT_UBE, SWAP_BANK and SECBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The BOOT_UBE and SECBOOTADD are frozen. SWAP_BANK can only be modified with TZEN set to 0xC3 (disabled).

Bit.Name: SECBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Unique Boot Entry Secure Adress.
